page.title: 09Twenty five years a villager
page.content: Chinley nestled in its valley on a wet June Sunday and it looked like our habitat.We moved in.The natives watched us,but we didn't knock over walls,the children went to the village school and we shopped in the village. It was the{W.I.}who invited me in first.Through them I helped to start Meals on Wheels and helped in the clinic. Next a lovely old railwayman said I still had work to do for Socialism and got me onto the Youth Club managers. I canvassed the area at elections and became a school Governor. Elected onto the Council I looked after the public areas of the Parish that was now part of me and I of it. When my husband was critically ill,their support was incredible. Serve a Derbyshire village and you know how real life brings the reward of real happiness.{ Margot Annand
